medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient presents with multiple congenital abnormalities and established chronic renal failure.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was noted to have multiple congenital abnormalities at birth. At the age of three years, she was diagnosed with Oral-Facial-Digital Syndrome Type I (OFD I). She had a cleft soft palate and a partial cleft of the hard palate, along with other congenital anomalies. Notably, she developed chronic renal failure by the age of 17, with ultrasound revealing polycystic kidneys. Treatment included conservative management initially, followed by dialysis after four months. She is currently on continuous ambulatory peritoneal dialysis and awaiting renal transplantation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history includes Oral-Facial-Digital Syndrome Type I, chronic renal failure, and surgeries for cleft palate and syndactyly. The patient also has marked dysarthria and cognitive impairment.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother has a history of Oral-Facial-Digital Syndrome Type I of lesser severity, with similar oral malformations and syndactyly. The mother's renal function is normal, but she has ultrasound-confirmed polycystic kidneys. There is no known history of congenital malformation or renal disease in the maternal family.
